headline: Slow Cooker Pulled Pork
description: Root beer and pulled pork? An unlikely pairing that makes a delicious secret sauce when simmered in the slow cooker. This easy method is a winner.

video.description: See how to make an incredibly easy pulled pork recipe.
video.name: Slow Cooker Pulled Pork

name: Slow Cooker Pulled Pork
recipeIngredient: 1 (12 fluid ounce) can or bottle root beer
1 (18 ounce) bottle your favorite barbecue sauce
8 hamburger buns, split and lightly toasted

recipeInstructions.text: Place pork tenderloin in a slow cooker; pour root beer over top. Cover and cook on Low until pork shreds easily, 6 to 7 hours. Note: the actual length of time may vary according to the individual slow cooker.
Drain well. Stir in barbecue sauce. Serve on hamburger buns.

review.reviewBody: Came out so tender and paired with Montgomery Ribs King sauce made all the more flavorful.
I’ve made this as written, and I have made it using modifications suggested in the reviews. It tastes better as written.
This is my favorite slow cooker recipe
We have made this multiple times over the years with different root beers and different BBQ sauces. Always a big hit! :)

Very easy and good. Definitely use the handmixer method to pull the pork. It is done in seconds. I like to put chicken stock in the broth for cooking. If I don't have root beer or coke, I put some brown sugar in.
so good everyone raved about it and it was so easy

Awesome recipe , super easy ! The second time I made it I soaked the loin in rootbeer overnight and put it in the slow cooker in the am before work and it was even more tender and flavorful . I assume the acid or carbonation broke down the meat enzymes and soaked into the meat more ?
I have made this recipe many times and is always a big hit in this house. I love making it for bbq never any leftovers and everyone enjoys it. Thanks so much for this amazing recipe. Deb Weaver
I loved it! Very easy to make, I know there isn’t any factor grizzle in it. Tasted great!

I made the recipe as printed and found it lacking in the depth of flavor my old recipe has. For a quick, cheap, easy recipe it may be okay for you, but I would rather take the time to add molasses, onions, etc, for a really good, deep flavor. I also think a cheaper cut with fat adds even tho you have to cool and remove the membrane and congealed fats later. JMO

But I did make some additions. I trimmed a little of the surface fat from it. I seasoned it with ground pepper, salt, and some garlic powder. I topped with some crushed red pepper flakes and let it stand for about 10 minutes. I sliced up a sweet onion and put it underneath. Then I poured in two cans of A&W Rootbeer. I cooked the pork on low for 7-8 hours. Then I shred it with two forks, drained it, then put it back in. Turned the slow cooker to warm, and mixed in some BBQ sauce. If you are ever near Cashmere, WA, pick up some Country Boys BBQ sauce!

I was so surprised that something so easy could test so great! I followed the recipe exactly. The only note I can add is to shred the meat using an electric mixer. I used my Kitchenaid and it shredded the meat in seconds. So much easier than using forks. Thank you for this delicious recipe!
Made exactly as written, using one suggestion to spray the pot with cooking spray first to help with cleanup. it was delicious.
It is incredible. It was really delicious! Easy to make, inexpensive and versatile. What’s not to love? Thanks for keeper recipe.
This couldn’t have been easier to make and was tasty and delicious!

I made this and actually received a very rare compliment on my cooking from my 15 year old! We all thought it was delicious. I only added three seasonings per another reviewer: I rubbed salt, pepper, and garlic salt on the pork before adding it to the crockpot. I sprayed my crockpot before putting the pork in for easy clean up afterwards. It was truly delicious and I'll be making this frequently! Thank you.
My family loved this recipe

My husband requests this all of the time.
Super tender and moist
Easy

4 stars because using tenderloin is a waste. As many others, I opted for a pork shoulder and the results were fine. I used about a liter of root beer for a 6 lb shoulder seasoned with dry rub , let it go for about 9 hours and then poured off the liquid. I then added a 18 oz bottle of Stick Fingers Carolina BBQ sauce and served on toasted hamburger buns. Tasted great for less than a $20 total investment.

I took this to a pot luck and got so many compliments. I had to pretend that I'm used to, and a little tired of people going on and on about how good a cook I am. I used two tenderloins and a shoulder, sweet baby ray original and store brand root beer. I wouldn't change a thing.

Only changes made added salt pepper and garlic salt before adding to crock as others suggested then used sweet baby rays bbq... excellent.... question how do i add my own notes to recipes? sometimes i can sometimes i cant frustrating, decided to start just putting in review my tweeks

Unbelievable! I got to say this was the easiest pulled pork recipe I've ever seen. Although when the pork is cooking in the root beer, the smell is less than favorable but that all goes away and 7 hours later the pork is falling apart. I drained it, put in the barbecue sauce and it was fantastic.
Great, and so easy

Made this for first time and it was excellent. Used pork tenderloin because I had it on hand and Faygo Root Beer (local Michigan product). I strained the cooking liquid after removing and shredding the pork and added some back in with KC Masterpiece bbq sauce. Mixed it all up and cooked for another hour on low. It was just enough sweet. My visiting family loved it and so did I!!

Loved this!!! I used pork shoulder like others have mentioned instead of the pork tenderloin, and I cut it up into three large pieces. I rubbed it down with Mrs. Dash onion and herb because my husband cannot have a lot of salt. I put it on top of red onion slices and I used Virgils zero sugar root beer, and it turned out absolutely amazing!!!
KETO anyone Amazing and practically no carbs!
Just tried this the other day for a family gathering. Excellent!
easy and delicious, every time
Way too watery, I used real beer instead of root beer and was glad I did, otherwise it would have been unbearably sweet.

Absolutely delicious! The root beer (I used A&W root beer) adds an amazing sweeter taste! After shredding the pork and adding the barbecue sauce I let it cook on high for another 1/2 hour to 45 minutes in the slow cooker to cook the barbecue sauce flavor into the meat more. Tremendous recipe!

This has been my father's go-to pulled pork recipe for years. He makes it with A&W rootbeer and usually Bullseye or Diana's BBQ sauce and it is just absolutely amazing. Often he'll get a whole pork loin and make a huge batch for parties and gatherings... Amazing! 10/10 recommend this recipe.

This smells terrible while it’s simmering, but don’t let that fool you, it tastes terrific when it’s done. Following some of the other suggestions I pierced the pork with a serving fork thoroughly before simmering to let the juices penetrate, and rubbed with garlic salt and pepper. Seven hours on low and it shredded very easily. Added plenty of Sweet Baby Ray’s with Vidalia, put back in the cooker and kept warm until ready to serve. Served on lightly toasted Hawaiian rolls with coleslaw. My wife and kids wolfed it down as fast as they could and asked me to make it again soon.

This is so good and so very easy for an impressive dinner that seems like you spent hours working on it. I did use a pork roast as that’s what I had on hand. I also seasoned it with a bbq seasoning I had on hand in my pantry. Served with coleslaw and Mac and cheese. This meal stretched for 3 days and I used it on nachos, stuffed zucchini boats I mixed with cream cheese and mozzarella. All this and that roast and bbq sauce with a can of root beer cost under 10.00.
I made this exactly as written and it was amazingly delicious! It made a lot and thank goodness because my kids kept eating - they loved it! So easy to make too ??????

When I first made it I didn’t care for it at all. The sauce was way too thin. But when I had the left overs a couple days later it was really good. You could taste the root beer and was a great flavor. So my suggestion is to cook it a couple days before you want it then heat it up when you want it.

This was amazing!! The family loved it and so easy to make. I followed one review and seasoned the pork in garlic, salt and pepper before putting it in the slow cooker. I also added some hot sauce and mustard to my bbq sauce at the end to give it some kick. The root beer marinade was amazing!!!
delicious!!
Family said the root beer pork tenderloin smelled awful I used IBC Root Beer and can’t believe how bad it smelled and tasted!!! Do not use root beer!!!

I made an account specifically to review this recipe. I started using this recipe back in highschool (2008) and still use it today (2020). I've made it a bajillion times in different ways and it has never been bad. I've made it using the ascribed pork loin and it wasn't bad, I did notice it was a little chewier but it was less fatty if thats a health concern. Generally, I follow others' rec to use a cheaper/fattier piece of pork and I usually season with some spices-always eyeball/different. But again, it has NEVER failed me. I don't even look the recipe up anymore most of the time but props to the author because you've saved my butt countless times as I've come into adulthood!
Outstanding. I always save some of the amazingly tasty juice to add to BBQ mix. I like mine very wet. Only way to make BBQ pulled pork- use for sandwiches, nachos, over mac and cheese
I say add a little more bbq but it’s amazing
So very good, the root beer made all the difference.

This was a very basic unhelpful recipe. While it sounds fun, it is basic and with little help. 8 hours in the slow cooker because there is no help in how much pork to use and how long. It ruined dinner that was started at 11:30am. Dont make the mistake that I did and think it is an easy recipe to make a great family dinner. If you do not have the skills to make pulled pork, this should absolutely not be your first option.
Definitely a keeper!! Made the husband and kids very happy!

I used a 6lb pork shoulder based on the reviews here. I also added a little All Seasoning (Mrs. Dash) and chives (I can't eat onion) to the meat. I poked holes in the meat so the flavor cooked through. Other than that, I followed the recipe as written. It turned out real good.

Using pork tenderloin as it is much lower in fat. Hubby also has to watch sodium and carbs. We only had a 1 lb tenderloin, so cut everything in half. Cooked on low foe 4 hrs, shredded, added a bit of barbecues sauce (just enough to moisten). Also made a vinegar based coke slaw to go with it. Great summer dinner

It was easy, but not much flavor other than sweetness. If you plan on dousing it in bbq sauce, it won't really matter anyway! It did break apart pretty easily, so I'm assuming the soda helped break it down.
Delicious! I lightly seasoned to taste. I flipped meat after first 3hours. I added barbecue sauce after 6 hours and let continue to cook the last hour. Will definitely be making again!!!
I followed the recipe and it was delicious. Topped it with creamy coleslaw and everyone loved it.

I’ve probably made this recipe 20 times. It’s perfect as is, no need to change it up! (I have used diet root beer a few times to help keep calorie count down and still tastes fantastic). Put this on your dinner rotation! So easy, you won’t be sorry!
So so simple and delish. My standard go to

This recipe is a staple in my house. I also use the Sweet Baby Rays (we like the hickory and brown sugar flavored sauce). I put the roast in my crock pot, lined with a liner of course and stick it in the fridge. The next morning I add my root beer and turn it on. I'm not a fan of the smell of it while its cooking so I stick the crock-pot on top of my dryer in the garage to cook all day. Get home, bring it in, drain it, pull it. Reline my crock-pot and add the bbq. Get it hot then eat it up! I also freeze leftovers in zippy bags.
Just ok. Really bland. Wouldn’t make this recipe again.
I had to use Coke Zero, but it still tasted delicious!

This is a terrific recipe. I used a large pork shoulder butt and browned it off in bacon fat first. I added it to slow cooker and poured one bottle of IBC root beer (it is made with cane sugar) and let it cook on low for 8 hours. I turned it once midway. I did not add barbeque sauce at the end as my man is on a special diet and we have a sensitive sauce for him. So I shredded it and let everyone add their own sauces to their bun as well as cheddar cheese and cole slaw. That way everyone could customize their sandwhich. Wonderful recipe and thanks Livie's mom for sharing it.

All my family loved it. I didn't use tenderloin pork but the shoulder. I let it sit overnight in the juice and shredded the next morning. I added 1 cup of the juice to the shredded port. Add 1 bottle of BBQ sauce to the shredded pork back in the crockpot and cooked on low for 1h25

My husband is not a big fan of pulled pork but he loved it!!! Said it was the best I have made!! I did salt and pepper it and added some Cookies Enhancer seasoning on the loin. I did a 5 pound loin for 8 hours on low in the slow cooker turning it over halfway through. I will be making this for a bridal shower I have coming up!!!

Wow. Wow. Wow. I kept reading a handful of the reviews before even making this and thinking, "well how good can this be?". Real good. I made it the night before so we could have it for the following dinner the next day. When I went to put it away for the night I had a few bites and didn't want to stop eating!! It was everything all the ratings said it would be! It was easy to make - and I too added the spices initially of the salt pepper and garlic salt - crock pot on low for 6 hours and then drained, added BBQ sauce and let it cook for one more hour on low. And WA-LAH!
excellent! I used pork shoulder
I used diet root beer to keep the sugar down. Excellent, and so easy.
Wife hates root beer. But she loved this recipe. Happy wife, happy life!

Amazing! Super simple to make and very yummy. The only thing I do differently is I let the root beer and meat slow cook together for about 4-5 hours. I strain it and then we put the sauce in and let it slow cook for another 2-3 hours. It’s so good!

I'll admit I didn't have high hopes for this recipe, what with so few ingredients (root beer in cooking??) But it was surprisingly good. And what it lacked in depth and nuance it more than made up for in easy assembly! And as with anything in the slow cooker, it was so tender it falls apart in your mouth
My husband and I liked the recipe and made no changes. Its super easy and takes no time to set up.
made pretty much per recipe except used picnic roast and a 2 litre of root beer. dad loved it and so did i. thanks for recipe
This recipe was easy, peasy and delicious. I preferred using a lesser expensive cut of pork so I used a Boston butt roast. No other changes. I would certainly make again. Easy for crowds.
Super easy and a big hit. My picky kiddo's favorite!
OY
Delicious. Family favorite!
We all love this!!! Tastes just like what I’d get at a bbq restaurant, if not better.

I added liquid smoke (2 ounces) in addition to the root beer. 

Cheers!

Delicious and Easy! Will definitely make again.
Not bad! I didn’t notice a ton of flavor coming from the root beer but I poured a bottle of Stubbs: Sweet Heat over the meat and it was delicious!

Here’s a review that just talks about what the ingredients are recommended. Slow cooked for 6.5 hours, pulled right apart. It really is as simple as pork, root beer, and a slow cooker. That’s it. If anything, it comes down to the bbq sauce you use. I used Stubbs original and was very happy with the outcome.
Great
This is an easy meal to make. I have picky eaters in my family and they all loved it. I toasted the buns with a little butter and garlic.
My entire family loved this!! I read through the reviews and tips, and I ended up doing: half root beer/half Pepsi for the soak. Rubbed the pork with garlic, pepper, and seasoned salt.
Added salt and pepper to taste to really increase the taste!!

My 20 year old son says this is the best pulled pork he's ever had. And we are Texans, so he's had his share of BBQ! I did make one change though- I used Dr. Pepper instead of rootbeer because that's what we had on hand. I will definitely make this again, likely often. Easy and delicious!

I have made this recipe twice now, and it's very easy and turns out great.
 
 I make it with two pork Tenderloins, as they typically come in at around 1.2 pounds each.

 I questioned using Pork Tenderloin vs Pork Shoulder but was very pleasantly surprised with the end product. It is exceptionally lean, and after 7 or 8 hours on Low it shreds very easily.
 This is about as easy as it gets for a tasty comfort food meal the whole family loves.

 We use Sweet Baby Ray's Hickory Brown Sugar sauce with it, but I know sauces are a very personal thing.

 We usually make nachos with chips, cheese and some sour cream on them, but it also makes a great sandwich or taco too !
So easy and so good! Highly recommended!
Good! Can’t be easier. I used diet root beer, would have never known. Poured off excess and added about 1/3 bottle bbq sauce. Pulled apart with fork easily.
So easy, and so delicious! I serve these with the hawaiian rolls, pickles on the side and coleslaw. Always a hit!
awesome recipe. easy to make and very yummy. another big hit with the family unit
Did not like it. No smoke flavor. Pulled pork needs to be smoked.
Best recipe I have tried for pulled Pork.
I didn't like this as much as I thought I would, but maybe I just used the wrong root beer? However, my husband enjoyed it.
It's good, for sure, and very very simple, which is great, but I wouldn't call it a 5 start. But definitely a good easy pulled pork.
I was good had a lot of flavor
Super easy, and it didn't dry out. We will be making this again!
It’s stupid easy and tastes good. Can’t ask for more!

This is a hit at every gathering - I never come home with leftovers. Simple to remember, and very easy to make. I occasionally add some diced onion to the root beer while it's initially cooking for just a little extra flavor.
Super easy put it in slow cooker went to grandsons soccer game came home ate dinner .
This is the best and a easy way to make pulled pork.

Rootbeer was good. I also made it with a can of Guinness beer...EVEN BETTER! :) 

For the bbq sauce there is one with Guinness beer flavor added to it. VERY good. Also Mesquite flavor is very nice.

I used a pork shoulder roast. I believe the fat content with this cut keeps the pork very moist. I entirely covered the meat with a and w root beer and left to cook for 10 hours then drained. I shredded and added very little bbq sauce, and put it back on for another hour . I am not a big fan of having pulled pork where the only flavour is bbq sauce. This was a fantastic simple resipe. I sprayed the slow cooker with coconut spray twice and clean up was a breeze.Two very big thumbs up.
My first doing Pull Pork and I follow the directions as instructed. It’s very good the pork is tender and it’s not dried out. I will use this recipe in the years to come
Absolutely amazing. Everyone in the house loved it.
Made this for a crowd. It was a hit! Made it just like the recipe was written.

Use pork shoulder instead of tenderloin and this is a great formula for a basic pulled pork. Just add seasonings and spices that your family like to finish and it'll be excellent. Also, don't forget to add some liquid smoke.
